featured.story: The Canon EOS R8 offers several aspect ratio options for still photos, including 3:2 (full-frame), 1.6x (crop), 1:1, 4:3, and 16:9. The camera's default aspect ratio is 3:2, which is a full-frame aspect ratio of 6000 x 4000 pixels. When using a 1.6x crop, the image size is 3744 x 2496 pixels. The other aspect ratios (1:1, 4:3, and 16:9) can be selected in the camera's settings and will result in different pixel dimensions depending on the chosen ratio. This is a test
featured.title: FEST
